summary: The law requires federal agencies to buy domestic products. But federal agencies can buy foreign products sometimes, e.g., when domestic items are not available at a reasonable cost or when international trade agreements waive the Buy American Act restrictions. According to the federal procurement database, foreign products comprised less than 5% of what the government bought in fiscal year 2017. The real amount could be...
title: Buy American Act: Actions Needed to Improve Exception and Waiver Reporting and Selected Agency Guidance
